resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
SECTION E: REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH (Complete this table for all married women aged 15 – 49 years in the household)
SECTION M: SOCIOL ECONOMIC STATUS OF HOUSEHOLD
Supporting Women and Girls in Pakistan Scaling Up
" Empowerment and Care Strategies to Address Health and Survival"
" Centre of Excellence Women & Child Health"

This information will be based on the list of villages generated from the district. Each enumerator will be given a list of clusters that he/she will be visiting, and before starting the interview, this information will be entered from the same list.
A103:\t Form Serial Number : Auto generated
Selected Head name present (A/C Line listing)
Please give me the names of the persons who usually live in your household, starting with the head of the household.
D103:\t Relationship to Head of HH
What is the relationship of [NAME] to the Head of the household ?
Son in law / Daughter in law
Brother in law / Sister in law
D106:\t Serial no of Father If father’s relation is “Not Available” in the members list then record code “NA”
D107:\t Serial no. of Mother If mother’s relation is “Not Available” in the members list then record code “NA”
D108:\t Date of Birth - If date of birth is not available record “00” and record age
If date of birth recorded then age will be automatically calculated from D.O.I and D.O.B
D110:\t Education What is the highest class (NAME) completed
For children less than five years, this variable will not be visible, and an auto generated NA code will appear.
D112:\t Total members of household (Auto calculated)
D113:\t Total married women of Reproductive age in household (Auto calculated)
D114:\t Total children of under 5 years age in household (Auto calculated)
D115:\t Is this Person available at home ?
E101:\t Have you ever been pregnant since your marriage ?
E102:\t How many times have you been pregnant since your marriage ?
Auto generate, depending on the number of pregnancies starting from 1
E104:\t Thinking back to your pregnancies, was this pregnancy single or multiple?
Similar fields will appear for the following pregnancies. The remaining pregnancies should be identified with the name of the pregnancy.
For example, “thinking back to the pregnancy after {name of the eldest child}……”
E105:\t Was the baby born alive, born dead or lost before birth ?
E106:\t In what month and year was {NAME} born? : Probe: When is his/her birthday ?
E107:\t Is {NAME} a boy or a girl ?
E109:\t What was the name given to the child ?
Record Baby 1, Baby 2 In case no name was given
E110:\t How old was {NAME} when he/she died?
E111:\t What was the reason for {NAME}’s death ?
On the way to the facility
E113:\t If born dead or lost before birth: In what month and year did this pregnancy end? (MM/YYYY)
E114:\t How long did the pregnancy last? (data will be converted to weeks for analytical purposes) (Months)
E115:\t Did you or someone else do something to end this pregnancy?
E116:\t God Forbid (Khuda Na Khuwasta), did any woman in your household die during 42 days after delivery in the past three years due to pregnancy related complications ?

MATERNAL MORTALITY STATUS The following questions now related to maternal mortality in the past 3 years in your household. (2017 — 2020) Definition of Maternal Mortality: Maternal death is the death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the duration and site of the pregnancy, from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from accidental or incidental causes.
E117:\t How many women have died ?
E120:\t Age at time of death (In Years)
High Blood Pressure during pregnancy (pre eclampsia and eclampsia)
On the way to the facility
F101:\t Did you see anyone for antenatal care during your last pregnancy with (name) ?
F101A:\t Why did you not go for antenatal check-up(s) during your pregnancy with {NAME} ?
A male/husband was not present to accompany me to the health facility
F102:\t Where did you seek ANC checkup for last pregnancy ?
F103:\t Who did ANC checkup during last pregnancy? Probe: Anyone else ?
F104:\t How far is the health facility where you usually receive antenatal check-up(s) during last pregnancy, from your home ?
F105:\t How do you usually travel to the health facility, where you usually receive antenatal check-up(s) during pregnancy with {NAME}?
F106:\t How long does it take to reach health facility, where you usually receive antenatal check-up(s) during pregnancy with {NAME} from your home ?
F107:\t Who accompanied you to antenatal check-up(s) during pregnancy with {NAME} ?
Nobody accompany me , I went on my own
F108:\t How many weeks or months pregnant were you when you first received antenatal care during last pregnancy with {NAME}? Record the answer as stated by respondent.
F109:\t How many times did you receive antenatal care during last pregnancy with {NAME} ?
Probe to identify the number of times antenatal care was received.
If a range is given, record the minimum number of times antenatal care received.
F110:\t As part of your antenatal care during your pregnancy, were any of the following done at least once
Ask about each option and circle all positive responses
F111:\t Do you have a card or other document with your own immunizations listed ?
If yes, ask: May I see it please ?
If a card is presented, use it to assist with answers to the following questions.
No (card or other document Not seen
F112:\t When you were pregnant with (name), did you receive any injection in the arm or shoulder to prevent you and the baby from getting tetanus, that is, convulsions after birth ?
F113:\t How many times did you receive tetanus injection during your pregnancy with (name)?
F114:\t Have you ever taken any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant?
F115:\t Who advised to take any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant?
F116:\t From Where did you get iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant ?
F117:\t How often did you take IFA during pregnancy ?
F118:\t How many months or days did you take IFA ?
F119:\t Did you pay for IFA ?
F120:\t On average, how much did you spend per month for IFA ?
F121:\t Did LHW visit your household during your last pregnancy ?
F122:\t How many times LHW visit, as part of your antenatal care during your last pregnancy ?
F123:\t What was the purpose of LHW’s visit during your last pregnancy for ANC ?
Informed about danger signs during pregnancy
F124:\t Did you get information about danger sign /problems during your pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F125:\t Will you please name any danger signs/problems that you are aware of ?
DO NOT READ LIST OR PROMPT with any suggestions such as Any other danger signs
F126:\t By whom Did you receive the information on danger signs/problems during your pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F127:\t Where did the health care provider tell you to go in case you notice danger signs/problems during pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F128:\t What danger signs/problems did you experience during pregnancy with {NAME} ?
No, I did not experience any danger sign
F129:\t Did you seek care for the danger signs/problems mentioned above ?
F130:\t Why did you not seek care from a health care provider for the danger signs/problems mentioned above during your pregnancy with {NAME} ?
A male/husband was not present to accompany me to the health facility
F131:\t Where did you seek care for the danger signs/problems you mentioned above during your pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F132:\t Did your diet/eating habit change during the pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F133:\t Did the nature of your household work (physical exertion) change during the pregnancy with {NAME} ?
F134:\t What preparedness measures did you take for {NAME}’s birth ?
Selection of health facility to go in case of complication
Arrangement of money to meet the emergency
SECTION G: DELIVERY PREPAREDNESS AND EXPERIENCE
G101:\t Did you know the expected date of delivery for {NAME}?
G102:\t Where did {NAME}’s delivery take place?
On the way to the health care Facility
G103:\t Why didn’t you deliver {NAME} in a health facility ?
If delivery take place at home Probe to identify any other reason Record all mentioned.
A male/husband was not present to accompany me to the health facility
G105:\t How far is the place from your home, where {NAME} was delivered?
G106:\t What mode of transport did you use to travel to the place, where {NAME} was delivered?
G107:\t How much time did it take you to reach the place, where {NAME} was delivered?
G108:\t Was your husband/partner present at the time of the delivery?
G110:\t Did the person, who delivered {NAME}, use a clean delivery kit?
G111:\t Did you pay for the clean delivery kit?
G112:\t How much did you pay for the clean delivery kit ?
G113:\t During your pregnancy with {NAME}, were you given a drug called misoprostol to prevent, stop, or reduce bleeding after delivery ?
G114:\t From where did you get misoprostol ?
G115:\t Did you take the misoprostol tablets?
G116:\t When did you take misoprostol tablets? Read responses to the respondent and select one.
After baby was born but before placenta came out
G117:\t How long did it take from the time the labour pains started till {NAME} was delivered? Limit Days!>3 Hour!>23 Minutes!> 59
G118:\t In total how much money did you spend on the delivery (from the time the pains started to {name}’s birth)?
G119:\t Overall how satisfied are you with the services related to {name}’s birth?
G120:\t What is the primary reason you are satisfied with the services related to {name}’s birth ?
G121:\t What is the primary reason you are moderately satisfied or dissatisfied with the services related to {name}’s delivery ?
G122:\t Did you know about danger signs/ problems during labour and delivery with {NAME} ?
G123:\t By whom Did you receive the information on danger signs/problems during labour and delivery with {NAME} ?
G124:\t Could you please name any danger signs/problems during labour and delivery ?
DO NOT READ LIST OR PROMPT with any suggestions.
Fever and too weak to get out of bed
Prolonged labour (defined as > 12 hours of regular strong contractions)
Foul smelling vaginal discharge green or brown water
G125:\t Was LHW present at the time of your delivery ?
G126:\t Did LHW provide you clean delivery kit ?
G127:\t Did LHW inform you about use of kit ?
G128:\t LHW informed mother about Postpartum Hemorrhage
G129:\t LHW advised mother to visit health facility for PNC
H101:\t What was the gestational age of {NAME} at birth? (month)
H102:\t Did {NAME} cry immediately after birth ?
H103:\t Did the person who was helping you deliver {NAME} take any measures to help baby breathe ?
H104:\t What measures were taken by the person delivering {NAME} to help him/her breathe ?
H105:\t Was {NAME} dried with clean cloth after delivery ?
H106:\t How soon after birth {NAME} was dried with clean cloth ?
H107:\t What type of cloth was used for drying/wrapping {NAME} ?
H108:\t What was used to cut the umbilical cord of {NAME} ?
H109:\t What was applied on umbilical cord of {NAME}?
H110:\t Did {NAME} get skin to skin contact with mother after birth ?
H111:\t How soon after birth, {NAME} was put on skin to skin contact with mother ?
H112:\t How long after birth {NAME} was breastfed ?
H113:\t Did you discard the thick milk (colostrum) that comes out of breast soon after delivery ?
H114:\t Why did you discard the thick (colostrum) milk that comes out of breast soon after delivery ?
H115:\t In the last 24 hours what was given to {NAME} to eat or drink ?
Exclusive breastfeeding is when a child is only fed breast milk, and not given anything else. This also includes water, or liquids for stomach pain etc.
Yes, Breast milk with other eat/ drink Item
H117:\t For how long did you exclusively breastfeed {NAME} ?
H119:\t For how many months did you breastfeed {NAME} ?
H120:\t How long after delivery {NAME} was given the first bath ?
H122:\t How much did {NAME} weigh at birth ?
H123:\t What is the source for weight information ?
H124:\t When {NAME} was born, was he/she very large, large than average, average, smaller than average or very small ?
H125:\t Now I would like to ask few questions on (name)’s health check-ups after birth.
After {NAME} was born, did anyone check on {NAME}’s health ?
H126:\t How long after birth, {NAME}’s first health check-up was conducted ?
H127:\t Where was {NAME}’s, first health check-up conducted ?
H128:\t Who conducted {NAME}’s first health check-up ?
H129:\t During the first health check-up, were any of the following done for {NAME} ?
H130:\t Did the health care provider recommended vaccines for {child NAME} ?
H131:\t Did you take {child NAME} for vaccination ?
Delivery conducted in some other area
H133:\t What is the purpose of LHW visit for new born ?
Referred to HCF for routine Check up
Provide support for mother to early initiation of breastfeeding.
Informed mother about new born danger signs
H134:\t Did you know about danger signs/ problems for new born ?

H135:\t Could you please name any danger signs/problems for new-born? DO NOT PROMPT Probe: Any other danger signs? Keep asking for more danger signs until the participant cannot recall any additional signs. Circle all that are mentioned, but do not prompt with any suggestions.
Movement only when stimulated or no movement, even when stimulated
Yellow or pale color on skin eyes
H136:\t Who informed your regarding danger signs for the new born ?
H137:\t Did the new born got BCG vaccination? (Usually leaves scar at left arm or shoulder)
H137A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for BCG ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
H201:\t In case {NAME} was delivered at a health facility, how long did you stay at the health facility after delivery ?
H202:\t Did anyone conduct a health check-up after you gave birth to {NAME} ?
H203:\t How long after delivery was first health check-up conducted ?
H204:\t Where did you have the first health check-up after {name}’s birth ?
H205:\t Who conducted your health check-up ?
H206:\t Did you know about danger signs/ problems after delivery ?
H207:\t Could you please name any danger signs/problems that may occur after delivery? Select all applicable.
High Fever, lower abdominal pain or foul smelling discharge (infection)
Severe headache, blurred vision, high blood pressure
Breast problems (engorgement, sore, cracked bleeding or inverted nipples)
H208:\t Who provided you information regarding the danger sign/problems after your delivery? Select all applicable
H209:\t Did LHW visit you after delivery ?
H211:\t What was the purpose of LHW visit, as a part of your PNC ?
Referred to HCF for routine Check up
H212:\t How long does the LHW spend time with you during her visit to your home ?
H213:\t How satisfied are you with her work and help that she provides you ?
H214:\t Are you aware of women groups’ discussion that are organized by the LHW and participated often to discuss issues pertaining to health of women and children in your area?
H215:\t What are the financial assistance mechanisms for supporting health care for poor and underprivileged ?
No Community Support for health care
H216:\t Has a male member from your household ever participated in the sN health committee meetings?
H217:\t What is the source of financial support for your MNCH related needs?
H218:\t Did you access any financial support for your last pregnancy or delivery ?
Don’t know about any such support
H219:\t What was the source of the financial support for your last pregnancy or delivery ?
H220:\t For what purpose the majority of this financial support was utilized ?
H221:\t To date, have you paid back the full or partial loan amount ?
H222:\t What were the methods of repayment that you used to pay back this loan ?
Sufficient HH income to pay back
H223:\t What is the strategy through which the remaining portion of the loan will be paid back ?
Sufficient HH income to pay back
Now I would like to ask you some questions related to diarrhea and Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) about less than 5 years of age children in your household during last two weeks.
I101:\t Has any child less than 5 years of age in the household had diarrhea in the last 2 weeks ?
An episode of diarrhea is defined as, “(three or more loose stools in a day/24 hours)”
I102:\t How many children had diarrhoea in the household in the last two weeks ?
I103:\t For how many days did {NAME} have diarrhoea ?
I104:\t Was there any blood in the stool ?
I105:\t Did you seek care when {NAME} had diarrhea ?
I106:\t Why did you not seek care for {NAME}’s diarrheal episode ?
The problem did not require care seeking
Had no money to pay HCP
A male was not present to accompany me to the health center
No permission from household head/husband /mother in law
I107:\t Where did you seek care for {NAME}’s diarrheal episode ?
I108:\t Who referred you to seek care at the facility for {NAME}’s diarrheal treatment ?
I109:\t How far is the health facility, where you sought treatment of {NAME} for diarrheal episode ?
I110:\t How long does it take to reach health facility, where you sought treatment of {NAME} for diarrheal episode?
I111:\t Who treated {NAME} for diarrhea episode?
I112:\t What treatment was given to {NAME} for diarrheal illness ?
Fluid from ORS packets or pre packed liquid
I113:\t Was the {NAME} hospitalized for diarrhea treatment ?
I115:\t For how long {NAME} was hospitalized ?
I116:\t What treatment was given to {NAME} during hospitalization to treat diarrhoea? Select all that apply.
I117:\t How much did diarrheal treatment of {NAME} cost you for medicine ?
I118:\t How much did it cost you on transport for diarrheal treatment of {NAME} ?
I119:\t Have you heard about ORS ?
I120:\t Are you aware about the preparation method of ORS (Oral rehydration salt) ?
I121:\t Where did you learn how to prepare Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS)?
I122:\t Do you know any danger sign of diarrhea ?
I123:\t Who provided you information regarding danger signs of diarrhea ?
I124:\t Could you please name any danger signs/problems that may occur in diarrhoea?
Not able to drink or feed anything
Skin pinch goes back very slowly
I125:\t Did LHW provided care / visit you when the child was sick with diarrhea?
I126:\t What services did she provide ?
Informed mother about home preparation of ORS.
Referral to HCF for Diarrhea treatment
Informed about danger signs of diarrhea
I201:\t Has any child less than five years had fever in the last two weeks in the household ?
I202:\t How many children had fever in the last two weeks in the household ?
I203:\t Has a child had an illness with cough that he/she breathes faster than usual with short, rapid breaths or has difficulty breathing in the past two weeks ?
I204:\t How many children have had an illness with cough that he/she breathe faster than usual with short, rapid breaths or have difficulty breathing in the past two weeks ?
I205:\t Did {NAME} have chest in drawing during the fever /and cough ?
I206:\t How many days did {NAME} suffer the symptoms of fever and cough ?
I207:\t Did you seek advice or treatment for {NAME}’s. symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I208:\t Why did you not seek care or treatment for {NAME}’s illness ?
The problem did not require care seeking
Had no money to pay HCP
A male was not present to accompany me to the health center
No permission from household head/husband /mother in law
I209:\t Where did {NAME} receive treatment for symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I210:\t Who referred {NAME} for treatment of symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I211:\t How far is the health facility, where you sought treatment of {NAME}’s symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I212:\t How long does it take to reach health facility, where you sought treatment of {NAME}’s symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing treatment ?
I213:\t Who treated {NAME} for symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing at the facility ?
I214:\t Was {NAME} hospitalized for symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I215:\t Where was {NAME} hospitalized for symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing treatment ?
I216:\t For how many days {NAME} was hospitalized for treatment of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I217:\t Was {NAME} given any medicine to treat his illness during his hospitalization for symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I218:\t What treatment was given to {NAME} ?
I219:\t Did {NAME} have a chest x-ray ?
I220:\t At any time during illness, did {NAME} have blood taken from his/her finger or heal for testing ?
I221:\t How much did it cost you for {NAME}’s treatment of symptoms of fever, cough and fast breathing ?
I222:\t Do you know any danger sign of pneumonia ?
I223:\t Could you please tell what danger signs may occur in pneumonia ?
I224:\t Who provided you information regarding the danger sign/problems in pneumonia ?
I225:\t Did LHW visit you when the child was sick with pneumonia
I226:\t What services did she provide ?
Used ARI timer to count breaths for the child when he was sick ?
Referral to any HCF for Pneumonia treatment
Information about danger signs of pneumonia
J101:\t Do you have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider where (name)’s vaccinations are written down ?
If yes: May I see it please ?
The respondent should already have brought the card when you got permission to begin the interview.
J102:\t Did you ever have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider for (name) ?
J103:\t Check and copy Date of Birth recorded on card
J10401A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for BCG ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10402:\t Oral Polio Vaccine dose at birth_OPV-0 (Day_Month_Year)
J10402A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for OPV-O?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10403:\t OPV-1_Oral Polio Vaccine first dose (Day_Month_Year)
J10403A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for OPV-1 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10404A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Penta-1 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10405:\t PCV-1 Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine 1st dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10405A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for PCV-1?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10406:\t RV-1 Rota virus Vaccine 1st dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10415A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for RV1 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10407:\t OPV-2 Oral Polio vaccine 2nd dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10406A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for OPV-2 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10407A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Penta-2 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10409:\t PCV-2 Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine 2nd dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10408A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for PCV-2?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10410:\t RV-2 Rota virus Vaccine 2nd dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10416A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for RV2 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10411:\t OPV-3 Oral Polio vaccine 3rd dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10409A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for OPV-3 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10412A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Penta-3 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10413:\t PCV-3 Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine 3rd dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10413A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for PCV-3 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10414:\t IPV (Injectable Polio Vaccine) (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10414A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for IPV ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10415:\t MEASLES-1 Measles vaccine 1st dose (Date _ Month_ Year)
J10415A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Measles-1 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10416:\t MEASLES-2 Measles vaccine 2nd dose _(Date _ Month_ Year)
J10416A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Measles-2 ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J10417A:\t Where (Name) received vaccination for Typhoid vaccine ?
Community Mother and Child health Centre
J105:\t Check J104: Are all vaccines (BCG to Measles-2) recorded ?
J106:\t In addition to what is recorded on the card you have shown me, did (name) receive any other vaccinations ?
J107:\t Go back to J104 and probe for these vaccinations.
Record ‘66’ in the corresponding day column for each vaccine received.
When finished, go to End of module.
J108:\t Has (name) ever received any vaccinations to prevent (him/her) from getting diseases, including vaccinations received in a campaign, immunization day or child health day ?
J109:\t Has (name) ever received a BCG vaccination against tuberculosis – that is, an injection in the arm or shoulder that usually causes a scar ?
J111:\t Has (name) ever received any vaccination drops in the mouth to protect (him/her) from polio ?
Probe by indicating that the first drop is usually given at birth and later at the same time as injections to prevent other diseases.
J112:\t Were the first polio drops received in the first two weeks after birth ?
J113:\t How many times were the polio drops received ?
J114:\t The last time (name) received the polio drops, did (he/she) also get an injection to protect against polio ?
Probe to ensure that both were given, drops and injection.

J115:\t Has (name) ever received a Pentavalent vaccination – that is, an injection in the thigh to prevent (him/her) from getting tetanus, whooping cough, diphtheria, Hepatitis B disease, and Haemophilus influenzae type b ?
Probe by indicating that Pentavalent vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Polio drops.
J116:\t How many times was the Pentavalent vaccine received ?

J117:\t Has (name) ever received a Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination – that is, an injection to prevent (him/her) from getting pneumococcal disease, including ear infections and meningitis caused by pneumococcus ?
Probe by indicating that Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Pentavalent vaccination.
J118:\t How many times was the pneumococcal vaccine received ?
J119:\t Has (name) ever received an inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) – that is, a shot in the thigh at the age of 14 weeks or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting polio ?
J120:\t Has (name) ever received a Measles Injection (MMR vaccine dose 1) – that is, a shot in the arm at the age of 9 months or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting measles ?
J121:\t How many times was a Measles Injection (or an MMR or MR) vaccine received ?
J122:\t Has (name) ever received a vaccine for Diarrhea (Rotavirus vaccine) ?
J123:\t Why (name) is not vaccinated ? If the child has not received all their vaccinations, ask the mother/caretaker.
Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons.
Child ill, brought but not vaccinated
Time or place of immunization not known
Took child but not vaccination day
K101:\t Have you ever heard of a method to delay pregnancy ?
K101A:\t From where you get the information about FP methods?
K102:\t Did you or your husband ever done something or used any method to delay or avoid getting pregnant?
K103:\t Are you or your husband currently doing something or using any method to delay or avoid getting pregnant?
K104:\t What are you doing to delay or avoid pregnancy? Select all that apply. Do not prompt. If more than one method is mentioned check each.
K105:\t From where did you get the current method to delay or avoid pregnancy?
K105A:\t Since when you are using current method without stopping it?
K106:\t Reasons for not using any family planning method? Select all that apply
K107:\t Did (LHW ) she provide Contraceptive pills/ Tell other Contraceptive Options
K108:\t Did LHW organize Health Meetings for You and Your husband?
K109:\t Do you know about any LHW HEALTH HOUSE in your area or near you?
L101:\t Do you have your own Mobile Phone?
L102:\t Aside from your own housework, have you done any work in last seven days?
L103:\t Although you did not work in the last seven days, do you have any job or business from which you were absent for leave, illness, vacation, maternity leave, or any other such reason?
L104:\t What is your occupation? That is what kind of work you mainly do?
L105:\t Are you paid for this job?
L106:\t Who usually decides, how to spend money you earn?
L107:\t Who usually decides how your husband’s earning will be used?
L108:\t Who usually makes decisions about health care for yourself?
L109:\t Who usually makes decisions about visits to your family or relatives?
L110:\t Do you own this or any other house/land/property?
L111:\t Is your name on the title deed or government recognized document for any house/land/property you own?
L112:\t In your opinion, is a husband justified in hitting or beating his wife in the following situations:
1. If she goes out without telling him?
If she refuses to have physical relation with him?
L113:\t Resource availability is a significant feature for human freedom. Women’s access to resources has following main components:
L114:\t Did you make decisions for family planning/contraceptive use?
L115:\t Did you decide how many children you should have?
L116:\t Did you make decisions for your children’s education?
L117:\t Did you make decisions for your child health/disease?
M101:\t Is the cooking usually done in the house, in a separate building, or outdoors ?
M102:\t Do you have a separate room which is used as a kitchen ?
M103:\t Main material of the floor
M104:\t Main material of the roof
M105:\t Main material of the walls
M106:\t How many rooms in this house are used for sleeping ?
M107:\t Does any member of this household own ?
M108:\t Does respondent (selected woman) of this household own mobile phone?
M109:\t Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?
M110:\t How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own?
M111:\t Does this household own any livestock, herds, other farm animals?
M112:\t How many of the following animals does the household own?
M113:\t Does any member of this household have a bank account?
M115:\t What type of fuel does your household mainly use for cooking
M116:\t What language do you usually speak in your household ?
N101:\t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household ?
Piped into compound, yard or plot
Surface water (river, stream, dam, lake, pond, canal, irrigation channel)
N102:\t What is the main source of water used by your household for other purposes such as cooking and hand washing ?
Piped into compound, yard or plot
Surface water (river, stream, dam, lake, pond, canal, irrigation channel)
N103:\t Where is that water source located ?
N104:\t How long does it take to get to the water source to get water and come back ?
N105:\t Who usually goes to this source to collect water for the household ?
Probe: Is this person under age 15 ? What sex ?
N106:\t How does that water in the household taste ?
N107:\t Was the water for drinking clear or muddy at the time of collection ?
N108:\t Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink ?
N109:\t What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink? Select all that apply.
Use water filter (ceramic, sand, composite, etc.)
N110:\t What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use ?
If not possible to determine, ask permission to observe the facility.
Flush to unknown place/Not sure/DK where
N111:\t Do you share this facility with others who are not members of your household ?
N112:\t Do you share this facility only with members of other households that you know, or is the facility open to the use of the general public ?
N113:\t How many households in total use this toilet facility, including your own household ?
O101:\t We would like to learn about the places that household members use to wash their hands. Can you please show me where members of your household most often wash their hands ?
O102:\t Observe presence of water at the place for hand washing .
Verify by checking the tap/pump, or basin, bucket, water container or similar objects for presence of water.
O103:\t Is soap, detergent or ash/mud/sand present at the place for hand washing ?
O104:\t What was available at the place of hand washing ?
Record your observation. Select all that apply.
O105:\t Do you have any soap or detergent or ash/mud/sand in your house for washing hands ?
O106:\t Can you please show it to me ?
hh14: Age of Respondent in completed years
hh15: Is respondent Head of Household?
hh16: Name and contact number of the head of Household:
hh17: Name and contact number of the respondent to head of the HH questionnaire (if head is not respondent):
hh18: May I start the interview now?
HH19: How many members are living in this household ?
Note for enumorators: Persons who live in this dwelling / compound and usually share a meal together
HH20: Does this HH have children 12-23 months years of age ?
i.e., children who have reached their first birthday, but not their second birthday
HH21: If Yes, Numbers of childrens 12-23 months:
HH21: Result of Household Questionnaire interview .
Note: Discuss any result not completed with supervisor.
No HH member at home or no competent respondent at home at time of visit
Entire household absent for extended period of time
Dwelling vacant or address not a dwelling
ch08: Is child eligible for Survey?
SS01: What is the mother tongue of the head of household ?
ss02: What is ownership status of household?
ss03: What is the main source of drinking water in your household?
SURFACE WATER (RIVER, DAM, LAKE, POND, STREAM, CANAL, IRRIGATION CHANNEL)
ss04: Do you take any step to make the water safer to drink?
ss05: What do you usually do to make the water safe to drink?

ss06: What is the main source of water used by members of your household for other purposes such as cooking and handwashing? If unclear, probe to identify the place from which members of this household most often collect water for other purposes.
SURFACE WATER (RIVER, DAM, LAKE, POND, STREAM, CANAL, IRRIGATION CHANNEL)
ss07: What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use? If ‘Flush’ or ‘Pour’, probe: Where does it flush to? If not possible to determine, ask permission to observe the facility
ss08: Where is this toilet facility located?
ss09: Do you share this toilet facility with others who are not members of your household?
SS10: If yes, how many other households use this toilet facility ?
ss11: Do you share this facility only with members of other household that you know, or is the facility open to the use of the general public?
ss12: How many households in total use this toilet facility, including your own household?
ss13: What is done to dispose the stools of the youngest child?
Put/rinsed on into toiled or latrine
ss14: Does your household have: Ask/probe for each [Multiple responses]
ss15: Does any member of this household own: Ask/probe for each [Multiple responses]
ss15f: Car or truck or bus
ss16: Observe what appliances are being used for source of light in the household. [Multiple responses]
ss17: What type of fuel do you usually use for cooking in your household?
ss18: Main material of the dwelling FLOOR Record observation. If observation is not possible, ask the respondent toDetermine the material of the dwelling floor.
ss19: Main material of the ROOF. Record observation.
ss20: Main material of the exterior walls Record observation.
ss21: How many rooms in your household are used for sleeping?
ss22: Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?
ss23: If yes, how many acres or canals of agricultural land do members of this household own? If less than 1, record ‘00’.
ss24: Do you have your own livestock, animals or poultry?
ss25: If yes, how many livestock, animals or poultry does your household own? Ask for each listed animals, one by one and observation by enumerator Insert 000 if none
ss26: Does any member of this household have a bank account?
ss27_title: Thank the respondent for his/her cooperation and then proceed with the administration of the children 12-23 month’s questionnaire for children present in this household۔
uf9a: Age of Mother/Care giver in complete years
Family Member without having knowledge if vaccination
uf12: Day / Month / Year of interview
uf14: Check if this respondent is interviewed for household or children questionnaire in this household?

uf15: ASALUM-O-ALAIKUM, my name is (your name). We are from NATIONAL MINISTRY OF HEALTH SERVICES, REGULATION AND COORDINATION, GOVERNMENT OF PAKISTAN. We are conducting a survey about the situation of the children health in Pakistan. I would like to talk to you about (child’s name)’s vaccination history. This interview will take about 30 minutes. All the information we obtain will remain strictly confidential and anonymous. If you wish not to answer a question or wish to stop the interview, please let me know. May I start now?

uf15b_title: Now I would like to talk to you about (child’s name)’s vaccination record in more detail. This interview will take about 30 minutes. Again, all the information we obtain will remain strictly confidential and anonymous. If you wish not to answer a question or wish to stop the interview, please let me know. May I start now?
uf16: Result of interview for children 12-23 months
No HH member or no competent respondent at home at time of visit
Entire household absent for extended period of Time
Dwelling vacant or address not a dwelling

cb0_title: Before I begin the interview, could you please bring (name)’s Birth Certificate, Immunization Card, and any other immunization record from a public or private health provider available in home? We will need to refer to those documents.
cb01: What is your highest grade of completed education? As for Education Grade passed for mother/caregiver (Write 77 if un educated and for Religious Education , write 20)
cb02: What is highest grade of completed education of (names) father?As for Education Grade passed for mother/caregiver (Write 77 if un educated and for Religious education write 20)

cb03: On what day, month and year was (name) born? Probe: What is (his/her) birthday? If the mother/caretaker knows the exact date of birth, also record the day; otherwise, circle ‘98’ for day. Month and year must be recorded.
cb04: How old is (name)? Record age in completed years and months. Record ‘0’ if less than 1 year.If Responses to CB3 and CB4 are inconsistent, probe further and correct.
im1_title1: Check eligible child’s age in CB4:

imtitle2: If child is not 12-23 months age group, probe once again and verify and if still not 12-23 months, end the interview with thanks to respondent. GO TO ELIGIBLE CHILD – INFORMATION PANEL UF16 and circle CHILD NOT ELIGIBLE/NOT 12-23 MONTHS AGE code 05.
im01: Do you have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider where (name)’s vaccinations are written down? (If yes: may I see it please)
im02: Did you ever have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider for (name)?
If not, why you didn’t receive any vaccination card?
Card was not available with the health provider
The vaccinator/ facility didn’t provide the card
im03: Check and copy Date of Birth recorded on card:

im4_title2: IM5.COPY DATES FOR EACH VACCINATION FROM THE VACCINATION CARD NOTE: WRITE ‘44’ IN DAY COLUMN IF CARD SHOWS THAT VACCINATION WAS GIVEN BUT NO DATE RECORDED. OR IF THE CARD SHOWS A DATE BUT YOU CANNOT READ IT CLEARLY. IF THE PARTICULAR VACCINE HAS NO ANY RECORD, WRITE ‘97’ IN DAY, MONTH AND YEAR COLUMN
im05: In addition to what is recorded on the card you have shown me, did (name) receive any other vaccinations?
im06: Check IM4: Are all vaccines (BCG to Measles-2) recorded?
im08: Has (name) ever received any vaccinations to prevent (him/her) from getting diseases, including vaccinations received in a campaign, immunization day or child health day?
im09: . Has (name) ever received a BCG vaccination against tuberculosis – that is, an injection in the arm or shoulder that usually causes a scar?

im10: . Has (name) ever received any vaccination drops in the mouth to protect (him/her) from polio? Probe by indicating that the first drop is usually given at birth and later at the same time as injections to prevent other diseases.
im11: Were the first polio drops received in the first two weeks after birth?
im12: How many times were the polio drops received? Numeric Number of times
im13: The last time (name) received the polio drops, did (he/she) also get an injection to protect against polio? Probe to ensure that both were given, drops and injection

im14: Has (name) ever received a Pentavalent vaccination – that is, an injection in the thigh to prevent (him/her) from getting tetanus, whooping cough, diphtheria, Hepatitis B disease, and Haemophilus influenza type B? Probe by indicating that Pentavalent vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Polio drops
im15: How many times was the Pentavalent vaccine received? Number of times

im16: Has (name) ever received a Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination – that is, an injection to prevent (him/her) from getting pneumococcal disease, including ear infections and meningitis caused by pneumococcus? Probe by indicating that Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Pentavalent vaccination.
im17: How many times was the pneumococcal vaccine received? Number of times

im18: Has (name) ever received drops for Rotavirus vaccine (RV) vaccination- A vaccine given orally soon after 6 weeks birth to protect against rotavirus infections, which are the leading cause of severe diarrhea among young children.
im19: How many times were the drops received? Number of times
im20: Has (name) ever received an inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) – that is, a shot in the thigh at the age of 14 weeks or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting polio?
im21: Has (name) ever received a Measles Injection – that is, a shot in the arm at the age of 9 months or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting measles?
im22: How many times was a Measles Injection vaccine received? Number of times
im23: Where from (name) is usually vaccinated? If the child is vaccinated from multiple sources, mention the usual source with higher frequency of vaccine doses.
Can you please specify where is this facility located?

im24: Why (name) is not vaccinated? If the child has not received all their vaccinations, ask the mother/caretaker Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons.
Child ill, brought but not vaccinated
Time or Place of immunization not Known
Took child but no vaccine available
Took child but not vaccination day
im25: Issue a Questionnaire form for vaccination records at health facility for this child. Complete the Information Panel on that Questionnaire
im26a: IM26A. RESPONDENT KNOWLEDGE ABOUT IMMUNIZATION
im26b: IM26B. RESPONDENT COOPERATION AND BEHAVIOUR IN RESPONDING TO QUESTION
im26c: IM26C. CARD AVAILABILITY, COMPLETENESS (SPECIFICALLY ABOUT CARD SHOWS A DATE BUT YOU CANNOT READ IT CLEARLY)
im26d: IM26D. OTHER COMMENTS IF ANY
Please add Info for second child.
